Somaliland calls itself an independent republic, but the rest of the world calls it the northern region of Somalia.

That was when Somalia's military dictator, Siad Barre, lost power in a ruinous civil war and this northern coastal region of the country declared itself an independent republic.
From that day to this, Abdillahi Mohamed Dualeh has been waiting for somebody, anybody to recognize his homeland.
One brave country announcing Somaliland, this is the ultimate call.
Dualeh is the foreign minister of Somaliland.

Our case is, in fact, even much better because ours is a unique case.
